result.execSummary:
The defendant Gerald R. Christian was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Gerald R. Christian

No weapons. No contact with Alexander H., Ana G., Jesse G. or their residences. Also authorized to look for financial records in his van, which may be parked on property. This modification is for today (10-8-14) only.

Attorney Andrew Burgoyne appeared for the State. Def. appeared without counsel. Clerk LE. Case was scheduled for preliminary hearing this morning.
